misdeed: An unnerving quiet has fallen over a region known for its treacherous bogs and marshes. Travelers disappear with alarming regularity, their belongings found abandoned near flickering lights that dance across the desolate landscape.
solution: The Vaesen is a Will-o'-the-Wisp and can be put to rest by returning the land it guards to its rightful owner.

clues.description: The disappearances coincide with the appearance of strange lights over the marshes, flickering like candles in the distance.
Those who have seen the lights describe them as hypnotic and alluring, drawing them closer with an irresistible pull.
Local legends warn of mischievous spirits that lead travelers astray, trapping them in the bogs to drown.
A search party discovers a walking stick, engraved with the initials of a missing traveler, driven deep into the mud near a cluster of flickering lights.
Research into local history reveals a long-forgotten land dispute involving a family who mysteriously disappeared, their property swallowed by the encroaching marsh.
As night falls, the investigators notice that the flickering lights seem to converge on a specific area of the marsh, marking the boundaries of the disputed land.

plotTwist.description: A descendant of the family who vanished, unaware of their history or the tragedy that befell them, has returned to the region, unknowingly drawing the Vaesenâ€™s attention.
